item.title: My Austin Job
item.description: Working at Juiceland At the end of November I started my new job at Juiceland :) I absolutely love working there. It has been a company I have loved and frequented regularly since I moved to Austin. It is so nice to get my favorite food for free and work with such fun, kind people. import pandas as pd import numpy as np df2 = pd.DataFrame(np.array([[1, 5], [2, 6], [3, 5], [4, 3], [5, 3], [6, 3], [7, 3], [8, 3], [9, 3], [10, 3], [11, 8], [12, 8] ]),columns=['month', 'happiness']) df2 ## month happiness ## 0 1 5 ## 1 2 6 ## 2 3 5 ## 3 4 3 ## 4 5 3 ## 5 6 3 ## 6 7 3 ## 7 8 3 ## 8 9 3 ## 9 10 3 ## 10 11 8 ## 11 12 8

item.title: Project 1: Exploratory Data Analysis
item.description: Choosing and Tidying Datasets These are datasets I will use in this project. I am deleting columns from the "happy" and "health" datasets that are not simple to explain and do not mesh well with eachother. Because the "happy" dataset is based off of the year 2015, I deleted rows that were not 2015 in the "health" dataset, and then deleted the column "year" due to this variable being the same throughout both datasets now.

item.title: Project 2: Modeling, Testing, and Predicting
item.description: Dataset I will be using a dataset describing secondary school students drinking behaviors in relation to several factors of their home and social lives. The 12 variables are: -sex -age -adress: urban or rural -pstatus: parents living Apart or Together -mjob: mother's job (teacher, healthcare, civil services, at home, or other) -fjob: father's job (teacher, healthcare, civil services, at home, or other) -tutor: 0=no tutor, 1=tutor -internet: 0=no internet at home, 1=internet at home -romantic: 0=no romantic relationship, 1=in a romantic relationship -go_out: scale of time out with friends.

item.title: Hello R Markdown
item.description: R Markdown This is an R Markdown document. Markdown is a simple formatting syntax for authoring HTML, PDF, and MS Word documents. For more details on using R Markdown see http://rmarkdown.rstudio.com. You can embed an R code chunk like this: summary(cars) ## speed dist ## Min. : 4.0 Min. : 2.00 ## 1st Qu.:12.0 1st Qu.: 26.00 ## Median :15.0 Median : 36.00 ## Mean :15.4 Mean : 42.98 ## 3rd Qu.
